voicesplitting.generic

Class MidiModelState

  • java.lang.Object
    • voicesplitting.generic.MidiModelState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    VoiceSplittingModelState

    public abstract class MidiModelState
extends java.lang.Object
    A MidiModelState represents the state of any of our MidiModels. Each state has a score, accessible by the getScore() method, and their natural ordering is based on this score.

    Anyone wishing to create a new type of Midi Model (besides a voice splitter) should extend this class to another abstract class defining that type of model's state, as was done in VoiceSplittingModelState.

    IMPORTANT: The correct functionality of MidiModelStates is dependent on any non-abstract subclass implementing the Comparable interface, ordering more likely MidiModelStates more highly. This is due to use of java's TreeSet object, which sorts based on the compareTo method of each object. Most likely, you'll want to use getScore() as the main metric for comparison, using other fields to break ties as needed.

    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 4 Sept, 2015

    • Constructor Detail

      • MidiModelState

        public MidiModelState()

    • Method Detail

      • getScore

        public abstract double getScore()
        Get the score of this MidiModelState. In general, a higher score reflects that a State is more likely given our prior knowledge.

        In almost every case, the natural ordering of MidiModelStates should be based on this score value.

        Returns:
        The score of this MidiModelState.

      • handleIncoming

        public abstract java.util.TreeSet<? extends MidiModelState> handleIncoming(java.util.List<MidiNote> notes)
        Return a TreeSet of all of the possible MidiModelStates which we could tansition into given the List of MidiNotes.

        NOTE: It is assumed that the notes Lists passed into this method will be passed chronologically. Specifically, each time this method is invoked, it should be passed the List of MidiNotes which occur next in the MIDI song currently being read.

        Usually, this method is simply called by some MidiModel's MidiModel.handleIncoming(List) method.

        Parameters:
        notes - A List of the MidiNotes on which we need to transition.
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of MidiModelStates which we've transitioned into.
